values:
Is it stupid that my feelings are hurt because my boyfriend has some 60 photos on his facebook and not one of me or us?

It's things that like that make me unsure of how he really feels about me.  Which, considering we've been together almost 3 years, sucks.

Maybe I'm just insecure.  Although, I never felt insecure when I was alone.

Do I see meaning when it isn't there?
Or, is meaning everywhere?

sick... flu.... getting better tho.

job/money matters steady and flowin'.

boyfriend world... bleh, feeling neglected and like I'm supposed to compete with his boss/douche/friend bag, but I won't.

been really nostalgic lately, having childhood memories flood me as if it were just yesterday.

overall, I'm longing for something and I don't know what.  It's that familiar "on the verge" feeling that seems to come before big stuff.

what's my point?  no, not of this inane, excuse for an update, what's my point in life?   

what the fuck am i doing?  where is my life going?  what do I want?
Total freakin' optimist even when I probably shouldn't be!  Let's just say in my life I've had to make a habit out of finding silver linings!

My faith in humanity has been restored through riot and destruction.

RIP - Oscar Grant



Thank god people are rioting.  Thank god people had the sense to capture Oscar's murder on their phones.  For once the fucking police are NOT above the law.  The whole scenario is so fucked.  Some dumb-ass, scared-shitless BART cop can't tell the fucking difference between his tazer and his glock?!?!  I don't fucking buy it!  If you can't tell the difference between those two weapons you have no business being in law enforcement.  And, in looking at the video footage, I don't even see why a tazer would have been necessary.  They had the poor fucking guy face down on the ground with another cops knee on his neck, sounds pretty restrained to me.  Not to mention, before they threw him to the ground he was on his knees with his hands in the air seemingly pleading with the cop who killed him.  I hope that cop goes to prision until Oscar's baby girl graduates college.  I just love thinking about what happens to cops when they go to prision.

Welcome to the police state everybuddy.... if you don't like it you only have one recourse... RISE UP!

Only, I do wish we could come up with some more productive form of riot-protest than breaking McDonald's windows and smashing cars.  If we could harness that riot energy and actually get some good revolution work done it would be so much better.

Ahhh retrograde... Thank god a friend pointed it out to me, because, once again, I didn't see it coming and thought I was going mad. Nope. Just mercury fucking with everything. It helps me to understand this. I have more patience with communication and dealing with my fellow monkeys. Can't we just push it into the sun or something?

It amazes me how when my life is good I totally neglect my LJ.  I guess if things are going well I'm too busy enjoying life to reflect on it.  I do feel truly blessed these days.  Sure, I still have problems, but mostly, things are well.  

I seem to be unaffected by the financial crisis hitting the nation.  I suppose things gotta get pretty dire before folks stop drinking (I'm a bartender).  Of course, I haven't been able to save a dime, but at least bills are paid and there's money in my pocket to go out to lunchies!  I hope when I'm an old lady I don't regret the amount of $ I spend on lunch now, but I just love going out to eat!

I have a car now.  It's my dad's old Toyota Camry.  It sat undriven for about 2 or 3 years and fired right up after a jump start!  I had my mechanic give it the works and it's been running like a dream.  Yay!  I even have a driver's license to boot!  

I love Trey so much.  I think his influence is partially responsible for me getting some of my shit together (like my license).  Our life together is pretty sweet.  He got rid of his storage unit over the summer so all of our things are mingled now and they go well together, just like us... awwwww!  

It's been a few weeks since Burningman and I think Trey and I are due for another adventure, maybe sailing in a week or so.  I bought him a nice river raft for his birthday, but I think we're going to have to wait until spring to really break it in.  We took it out to Lake Pyramid before Burningman and paddled around.  Super fun, but we got super sunburnt, too.  Neither one of us burns very easily so we neglected to bring enough sunblock.  And after BM, we stopped and camped at Donner Lake.  We were a bit too worked to go out on the lake, but we went to the Donner Museum and watched the gnarly movie about the Donner Party.

OooOOooh!  That gives me an idea... wouldn't it be funny if someone threw a Donner Party?  Sure it's in poor taste, but then aren't all the bestest things?!?!?  Think of all the "finger foods" you could serve.  There's a lot of cannibal humor out there!  Cannibals... the new zombies.

Went to an awesome 5lowershop renegade last night... so nice, beautiful view of so san, fat fukkin beats, bunch of friends I haven't seen in a while.  Yay!

Trey and I are leaving for Burningman next Fri.  I think it's gonna be a nice year.  Although, I'm almost looking more forward to spending a day at Pyramid Lake than a week at BM!  I love that lake.  Thursday night Trey and I are hosting a party at Camp Zoom on the Esplanade.  If you have music in the format of cds or an ipod or laptop come on by and BRING IT!  I'm going to make a big 'ol vat of jungle juice for the occasion so come on by and have a cocktail with us!  Cheers!

Also, after the burn, on Sept. 6 I'm helping throw a SPAZ fundraiser for a friend who is fighting a custody battle for his child.  More details on that soon, but it will, of course, rock.

And, Sept. 30th is my next Ladies Night "SKIRTS" at Oasis.  The last one was a hoot and a half so you don't want to miss this next one cuz it'll prolly be even better!

Oh, and far into the future... Dec. 13th I'm planning the biggest event I've ever thrown, possible venue is Sweet's Ballroom (so you get an idea of how big this shit's gonna be!)

All in all,  I've been keeping busy, loving life, manifesting moolah, and always looking out for the next big adventure.
Hozabout a nice story about a sweet chinese couple.
If thoughts really do have power and I'm creating my own reality as I go then why the fuck can't I blow up the world with my mind no matter how hard I try.

I really just want the holidaze to go away this year.  Normally, I feel very festive and hostess-ey around the daze.  I've just been in a funk and happy memories of childhood christmas' keep flooding my mind.  Holiday seasons when I had a family, a whole family.  

Christmas pretty much took a shit for me when my mom died.  In fact, family took a shit for me when my mom died.  My extended family had always seemed really close when I was growing up, but after my mom died (just when you think family would come together) it fell apart.  My connection to aunts, uncles, and cousins dropped off into some sort of bottomless pity.  My mom's been dead ten years.  My brother has been dead 14 years.  My life with them feels like some movie I saw a long time ago.  My greatest fear after they died was that I would forget them, forget the sound of their voices, their smell, their idiosyncrasies.  And, like most fears, it is realized.  Only, I do still remember many of the details of who they were.  What feels lost and forgotten to me is who I was.

After moving to California and seeing so many different "community" families coming together I think I must have felt touched and inspired and maybe a little hopeful that I could find a place for myself.  But, after years of attempting to contribute and include myself here and there I remain feeling like an outsider.  I think it's true, you can't go home again.  I'll never have a family like I did.  Sure, I'll have deep friendships, loves, and bonds with other people and communities, I may even reunite the energy I once had with my extended family, or start a family of my own someday, but I'll never again have the family feeling I grew up with.  And, I feel as though it was taken from me before I was old enough to even appreciate it.

I totally digress from the point of this purge.... I hate christmas because once upon a time I loved it.

I suppose I should be happy that I'm old enough now to realize that this bringing a tear to my eye is just some crazed form of pms.


And, my analysis of why exactly I would become choked up at this.... well, I'm hoping that it's "because beauty pageants are disgusting and this poor girl probably lost her childhood to perfecting this act" and not "oh that poor girl spent all that time coming up with this dynamic act only to have tech problems and then have her performance awkwardly interrupted, but still she carried on, what a survivor!"

Who am I kidding.... I think my soul was shedding a tear for the 4:51 I spent watching this along with however many other retarded youtube clips I've clicked on today.

fucking youtube.

Once I sacrificed peace for chaos
I didn't know it at the time
I only recognized my uncontrollable desire
for passion

Now, there is no going back.

overall, I'm doing well.
It's just this damn temporal existence that gets to me from time to time.

bah.

Returning from the most fabulous day...

Went to Half Moon Bay to purchase this:


Wood Burning Stove to heat my cold-ass warehouse this winter!!!

And,  while we were in the neighborhood, Trey and I kayaked around the bay nearly all the way to Mavericks!  The weather was georgous, the sun poked out and the fog rolled away just as we embarked on our journey.  We paddled past tons of pelicans, sea gulls, and other sea birds on the rocks .  Sea Lions popped their heads up around us from time to time.  And, the greatest moment for me was when we came right up to a sea otter!  He was the most adorable, playful thing!  He kept doing cute, little somersaults and flips in the water inbetween preening himself in his kelp bed.  He wasn't the least bit afraid or intimidated by us (which intimidated me a little!)  I've always wanted to see an otter up close and today I got my wish. 

Trey got lots of pics and short film clips of our outing.  He's been putting together little movies on You Tube.  Here's his page  http://www.youtube.com/2Xintheface   I'm sure it will take him a few weeks to edit the footage we got today but he's really got a knack for putting all the little clips to music.  I can't wait to see what he comes up with for the pelican montage!

I have a You Tube page, too, under sugarbunni (what else?).  But, Trey has a lot more going on on his page than me.  In fact, the only video I have posted is one that Trey edited of shots from our Mt. St.Helen's climb.

Anyhow, life is good.  I love my new wood stove (now just need to install it!) and I love my adventurous, creative boyfriend. 

Oh, and I love otters!

by  redstickman and blabsicle


A. List seven habits/quirks/facts about yourself.
B. Tag seven random people to do the same.
C. Do not tag the person who tagged you or say that you tag "whoever wants to do it."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1.  I like to do things backwards when ever possible
     (i.e. read endings first, try to put something together then read the directions, fall in love then get to know someone ;o)

2.  I can smell when snow or rain is coming.

3.  I secretly wish I was a cartoon (and sometimes behave with the same reckless abandon as one)

4.  I'm cheap, preferring thrift stores to retail ones.  (Although, I will drop some dough on din-dins and drinks!)

5.  I have a weakness for critters, especially furry ones (but, I love my snakes and fishes, too!)

6.  I nearly drowned in the Bahamas when I was five, but have still always loved the water.  I also got bit in the face by a St. Bernard as a       kid and have still always loved dogs.

7.  Currently, I'm creatively working on a collaborative show with my homegirl P-Raw.  We're quite excited and many resources have presented themselves in support!

Now, I tag...
elgee_isaac
 
_silent_star_
 
creamyg
  spidra   neonbunny  
perstefani
 
mermaidsmusings

Yeah, tumultuous.  That's  a good word for the last couple days.

Super Happy Fun Time was a blast, but also a bit tumultous.  And, I've been answering the question "What the hell happened here?" from everyone I work with at Oasis regarding the mess (that took about 3 cleanings to resolve).  Flour bombs, bithday cake fights, and firecrackers can really fuck shit up!  The owner had enough fun with the night that I'm not really feeling any heat over the state of the place tho.  I promised him the next one would be tidyer.  Btw, next one is on Oct. 9.

The rest of the tumultuity (is that even a word?) is personal bullshit.  I'm having a conflict with the masturbater of all conflicts in my warehouse right now.  I just can't help thinking that I wish this person would implode and shoot out on the other side of the universe and be some aliens problem.  What really sucks is that due to this person/circumstance my boyfriend world is stressed to say the least.

I played 2nd chair violin when I was in school.  And, I got my fill of playing second fiddle back then.  I most certainly don't need to feel that way now.  All in all, I feel unaturally insecure and jealous (that's just not usually me) and feel that my relationship is being underminded by outside forces (i.e. the dickhole I refer to in the previous paragraph).  Being in a relationship is enough work without feeling plotted against.

Thank goodness there are many, many more lovely people in my life than dickholes.  My sweet neighbor just called and wants to go to lunch.

That helps.

Life is amazing.  In the past 24 hours I have had 3 good friends I haven't seen in many years contact me.  One of them is getting married on Saturday!  I can't wait to go.  Another is visiting from FL (for the fore mentioned wedding) and always such a fabulous boost to have around.  The third was a call from an old friend from St.Louis who seems to check in with me every 2 years or so.  He'll be visiting next week!  The common thread all three of these folks have is that every time I see them it's like no time has passed between us and we pick up where we left off.  It's so refreshing. 

With all the aggravated feelings I've had around social cliques lately it nice to know I have more true friends out there than I realize sometimes.

As overheard from the street outside my window today....

(in a drunken sing-song children's style tunage)

I go riding in my automobile...
All I want is the pussy
pussy, pussy, pussy


Never a dull moment out there!  
Thanks Market St.!

Working my ass off lately bartending.  Stoked on the cash, but feeling a bit ragged.

Also, feeling estranged from many of the social circles I once sought to include myself in.  And, really, it's refreshingly liberating.  I think what's actually happening here is a raising of the bar.  My standards of community and of friends has been raised and as some don't make the cut others who are way more conducive to my progress as a human step up.  It's quite the illuminating social experiment.

Boyfriend world is good, although when I work so much we don't get a lot of quality time together because of the differing schedules.  His birthday is coming up.  He doesn't seem to care about it too much, but I'm going to do my best to make it special.  I also have a gift I'm getting him that I know he'll be stoked on.

All in all life is good.  Transition is always a challenge I guess, but I do enjoy the newness it brings to things.

I've got an event coming up on Tuesday Aug. 14th at Oasis that I'm really excited about.  The Mole and I are collaborating to bring the world "Super-Happy-Fun-Time-Amusement-Extravaganza!!!"

Stay tuned for more super-fun details on that!

Life is full of disappointments when you have expectations.  
But, how do you set goals for yourself if you don't visualize some sort of outcome and create an expectation?  
I suppose the key is to stay flexible, roll with the punches, etc.
Or, maybe it's just another crap lesson in suffering
Not that I'm not thankful, suffering is learning, yada, yada, yada...

Some part of me feels to accept disappointment is to admit failure
And who likes to do that?

As spontaneous as I like to fancy myself I'm annoyed when things don't go as planned

The lesson I'm taking away is to re-focus my energies inward.

We didn't break up.
We talked it out.
He said he was sorry and didn't mean it.
He said that he loved me. 
(which is the first time I've heard it from him).
Not exactly the circumstances under which I was hoping to hear it.
But, o-well.

The pain of his original statement still lives in my mind.
But, part of me thinks it was some sort of test.
Deep down I know that he would be hurt if I was with someone else, 
just as I would be if he was unfaithful.

Relationships are hard work.
That's the moral of this story.
I used to think that it was all in the hands of fate
to deliver your perfect mate to you.
Now I realize it's up to you
to invest your time, energy, and love
into someone.
And, to not give up on things too soon,
I suppose.

Kinda devastated right now.
My boyfriend tells me he doesn't  care if I fuck other people.
I don't think I can be with him now.
There has been an imbalance I've been ignoring for sometime.
It's not that I think he wants to be with other people.
I do trust him.
But, if he doesn't care enough to want me in the same way, 
I just can't do this.

I want monogomy.
One on one love.
I want love.
True love.
Deep love.
Love that can express itself.

I'm sick with the thought of him leaving, 
but , I suppose it's a familiar sickness, 
so, I can take it.
I love him.
But, I realize I don't always love people who are good for me.

The thought of being on my own again is the only comfort.
I'm good alone.
Not so many moods.
Plenty of space.

I suppose it's just one uncomfortable conversation away now.

something about kermie blowing for junk makes me realize my life isn't so bad.  Although, the glimpse of a photo of Jim nearly brought tears to my eyes.

A sort of funky wake has been washing over me of late.  And, for no real discernable reason.  Everything is.... ~okay.

I've never been one to be satisfied with okay, or average, or just allright.  Something in me would rather have things be bad than average.  So, I'm trying to understand this about myself and deal with it in a positive way rather than just reaking havoc on my life per usual.

I'm craving passion.  Sometimes that's a good thing... passion inspires to create, or spices up your bedroom, or pushes those boundries that have been taunting you.  But, sometimes passion just goes lookin' for a fight.  That's what I'm trying to avoid.  I don't want my funk to get so bad I start making drastic changes in my life.  I'm in a sort of pre-funk now.  Where I can see it coming, I know what to expect, and I know my former patterns.

Not sure where I'm going with all this.  I guess I just needed an outlet.  I have lots of positive things going on in my life right now to be grateful for, why is it so often my nature to focus on the one or two things that are wrong?

And, why does my poor old live journal always have to listen to me bitch?!?!

Ya know, maybe I am some sort of puritanic prude.  Maybe I don't jive well in the "live and let live" open-mindedness of the bay area.  But, when I'm hanging out with friends and a tin foil trough pops out and people start smoking HEROIN and CRACK in front of me it's going to be hard for me to hide my surprise and judgement (especially after some nips of whiskey).

And now, I get the lovely bay area pleasure of explaining my judgement to said friend through e-mail.  Geezus!!!  Am I acutally expected to apologize for being "negative and judgemental" over this?  I can tell what my friend would like to hear is that I'm sorry I was a bummer and I don't judge her as a person for those actions and to each his/her own...  But, that would be a big fat lie.  I have very strong opinions and jugements about heroin and crack.  Namely, I don't associate with anyone who does either.  No thanks, I've got too many dead friends already from heroin and if I wanted to hang out with people who smoke crack I would simply walk to my nearest neighborhood corner.

It's not that I feel I can't be friends with her anymore.  But, I already know I don't feel safe partying with her (especially late at night) now.  I'm still just so shocked that those drugs were casually brought out.  I'm posting this in an effort to clear my thoughts and absorb what happened so that I can reply to her e-mail.  I still don't know what to say to her tho.  All that comes into my mind is the truth, which, I'm sure, will sound just as bad as it did on the night in question when I seemed "negative and judgemental".  

Yeah, fuck... still don't know what to say to her.  Why is this on me?  Why am I the one having to explain my actions here?  WTF?!?!?!?!

I'm bartending happy hour at Oasis in Oakland on 12th today.  The "doodlebum" rule still applies.  If you work in downtown Oakland stop in and say "hi"!
I'm bartending tonight at Oasis (downtown Oakland on 12th near the lake).  I think maybe it's a house night?  Not sure, but if you come up and say "doodlebum" I'll buy you a drink!

I'm older now
I've learned

how to control my mind
a bit better

I can cohearse myself into 
a healthier frame of mind
temper my reactions

but, that goddamn gaping pit of despair in my chest

what do I do about that

so far

  ignoring it doesn't seem to be working

there is no love without pain 

I suppose

but that fucking sucks.

10 things surrounding me right now:

1.  A nearly empty teacup
2.  Miss Kitty
3.  A giant skeleton of an egg
4.  "Sex, Time, & Power" by Leonard Shlain
5.  A decapitated Jabberwock , complete with claws
6.  "Alberta" my X-mas tree, struggling to survive but seems to be pulling thru
7.  Skulls
8.  "The Guy" (still smirking after all these years)
9.  Excercise ball
10. 2  dogs that need to be walked - bye!


Now you do it?  Why?  I don't know.

Whew!  This weekend was such a blur!

Bunny Jam was a blast.  It's so rediculous and absurd!  I love it!

I'm glad I was able to power through the night after getting no sleep the night before finishing that giant fucking egg!  That project was a real pain in the ass, but it got done and it seemed like people enjoyed it.  It did have an unfortunate "hatching" toward the end of the night tho.  Luckily, no one was hurt.  Bunny's are harder on furniture than my dogs!  Heh!

Trey had the idea to fiberglass the egg.  I hadn't really thought of the egg living beyond BunnyJam, but I suppose if I can figure out where to store it it could live on. 

If anyone out there has any good pics of the egg I'd love to see 'em.  I never remember to take a camera!
